Articles.Content:
I have a dream that repeats over and over again.

Nearby is a strange entity, a something that pulsates like a heartbeat and changes its shape constantly. It's mostly black smoke, but there are solid bits and lights moving inside. It's ominous but I'm more fascinated than scared. I usually keep a distance of a few meters and just watch it.

I haven't dreamt in a while...

If I have, I forgot.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-05-14T02:50:04Z" title="05/14/2017 02:50  AM" data-short="7 yr">May 14, 2017</time> by qzgy**

Last night I dreamt I found a secret doorway to an interdimensional train station. I came back the next day with a luggage and got on a train to a completely alien place, with people I'd never met, not knowing if I'd ever come back. It was a cozy train, though.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-05-15T03:37:33Z" title="05/15/2017 03:37  AM" data-short="7 yr">May 15, 2017</time> by cubinator**

I dreamed that my crush *actually loved me*

\*Bangs head against the wall\*

(seriously)
I had a dream that I was a pedant soldier and saw our demon-possessed pedant commander was getting exorcised by his soldiers
I dreamed I was popular. \*sigh\*

> 
> 
> On 4/14/2017 at 9:36 PM, Adstriduum said:
> 
> 
> My lucid ones. Still trying to get to Jupiter without freaking out. Space is scary ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")
> 

You're probably in for disappointment; I tried going to the Moon, but the scenery there had nothing to do with it, no matter how hard I thought about pictures of its landscape. Jupiter is probably going to be something similar to something you've actually seen.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Aperture Science said:
> 
> 
> You're probably in for disappointment; I tried going to the Moon, but the scenery there had nothing to do with it, no matter how hard I thought about pictures of its landscape. Jupiter is probably going to be something similar to something you've actually seen.
> 

Just went there and it looks exactly like Jupiter... It is different for everyone.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-05-17T04:26:57Z" title="05/17/2017 04:26  AM" data-short="7 yr">May 17, 2017</time> by Adstriduum**

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, Adstriduum said:
> 
> 
> Just went there and it looks exactly like Jupiter... It is different for everyone.
> 

Oh, wow; guess I was unlucky then
Any dream is crazy if it's not when you're asleep.

> 
> 
> On 5/16/2017 at 4:08 PM, Core said:
> 
> 
> I had a dream that I was a pedant soldier and saw our demon-possessed pedant commander was getting exorcised by his soldiers
> 

I think some of my text just got censored...

"Pedant" just doesn't have the same effect as saying I was an enthusiastic 1940s German soldier.

Last night I dreamt I was walking up my driveway to the front door at night, and I happened to startle this huge bat. It was as big as my head, and I didn't want to aggravate or anger it so I tried to move away, but every time I moved the stupid bat would fly to exactly the place I was going and alight there. This went on for at least a minute before I finally got to the door.

I think my dream was that a mobile game took over the world and there were these things called "fake Russians"

whaaaaa?

Last night I dreamt I was in a huge meteor shower. Hundreds of small streaks crossing the sky, clearly radiating from a point just above the horizon. You could see just how fast Earth is moving through the solar system by looking at the speed of the meteors.

I ended up walking down to the local garage to pick up a Sinclair C5 (which would be crazy in its own right, I've also never even seen one) and, while walking, looked up to see a red-liveried aircraft resembling an IL-76 fly upside-down overhead before righting itself. While returning home in the C5, I looked back to see the same aircraft attempt to pull off an aerial loop in the distance, but failed to pull up and crashed (Shoreham resemblance?) into a mystery city I can't help but call Brighton (which is >60km away). All the while with me recording it on a mobile phone like any good bystander should.

Fin.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, voicey99 said:
> 
> 
> I ended up walking down to the local garage to pick up a Sinclair C5 (which would be crazy in its own right, I've also never even seen one) and, while walking, looked up to see a red-liveried aircraft resembling an IL-76 fly upside-down overhead before righting itself. While returning home in the C5, I looked back to see the same aircraft attempt to pull off an aerial loop in the distance, but failed to pull up and crashed (Shoreham resemblance?) into a mystery city I can't help but call Brighton (which is >60km away). All the while with me recording it on a mobile phone like any good bystander should.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Fin.
> 

"...and then I realised I was filming vertically the whole time!" AAAAAAGH NIGHTMARE!!

![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
I only remember my dreams when I am really stressed (found that out during finals) I am not 100% sure on this but possibly when I am really tired.

About 17.14% (roughly 1/6th) of my dreams are lucid. I would ~~like~~ LOVE to raise that number.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-06-17T01:27:57Z" title="06/17/2017 01:27  AM" data-short="7 yr">June 17, 2017</time> by Adstriduum**

Well, I had one after I read chuck yeagers biography, I was flying inverted in a cessna 172, and the ailerons locked up, then the engine stalled.... then a ejection seat pops out of know were, and I eject into the ground.....

My dreams are never ever ever realistic. And thats good because i have a TON of weird stories to tell.

One if wich was quite recent. I dreamt that we were on a school excursion thing, and a girl who i have a crush on right now unnoticedly shrunk, to the size she fit in side a small tube.

When I was younger, I always had a dream where I was floating above a tropical ocean. There was an island in the distance, but I'd stay and watch the waves. All of a sudden, I'm now falling, and a shark is sitting right below me with his jaws wide open. Eventually after falling, right before he ate me, I'd wake up.

Saved by the bell I guess.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-06-18T00:45:53Z" title="06/18/2017 12:45  AM" data-short="7 yr">June 18, 2017</time> by V7 Aerospace**
Just had a dream about making breakfast, but everything was going wrong...

> 
>

> 
> 
> Just had a dream about making breakfast, but everything was going wrong...
> 

Would you like to go into it?

> 
>

> 
> 
> Saved by the bell I guess.
> 

I think it's just because our brains don't have any idea what it's like to die.

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, munlander1 said:
> 
> 
> Would you like to go into it?
> 

It was mostly just me trying to crack eggs, but every time there were shells in the eggs every time, and every time it happened....
